info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 21 at 5:33PM MDT by NWS Saltlake
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southwestern Kane County through 615 PM MDT... At 532 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 16 miles east of Kanab, moving southeast at 20 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and nickel size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This storm will remain over mainly rural areas of southwestern Kane County. This includes US Route 89 between mile markers 42 and 53. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.88 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
